newsitem.title: USA: US cash crudes rise sharply, sweet grades advance.
newsitem.headline: US cash crudes rise sharply, sweet grades advance.

text.p: U.S. cash crudes have risen sharply on an outright basis in-line with futures market rallying, while cash grades also racheted higher.

April West Texas Intermediate/Cushing was tracking around $1.25 higher at $22.15-25 per barrel, mainly on technical buying and the closing of a portion of the Mississippi River due to a barge accident.
Traders said the fear refined crude products shipments may be delayed by the river closing set off a buying spree on the NYMEX market.
Grades were pushed to the sidelines, but deals were noted.
